page.title: 03General Information
page.content: In 1981 a survey of buildings and population in Weeley Parish was carried out, the results were:- 1 Post Office,3 general stores,1 butcher's, 1 newsagents, 1 DIY store, 1 garage, 1 restaurant, 1 Public House, 1 tyre department, 1 recreation ground, 1 village hall, and 1 primary school. In 1931, the population of Weeley was 692.In 1981 the number was 1577. Also in 1981 were 689 houses. There were 328 children under the age of 16, and 408 retired people. In 1976, 10 people were working in Weeley factories, 50 people working in agriculture and 220 working in shops and offices.Ther are 16 sites for new houses, and they are hoping to add 37 new houses.Over the next 10 years, a new factory will be built, and a new playing field will be made.
